Package com.android

Class Stock

java.lang.Object
com.android.Stock
public class Stock
extends Object
a example of a singleton that is a stock room for a supermarket which has three test products as illustration but could be expanded to accomodate more products To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial
Author:
NoelF

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private static class  Stock.Products
    enum that has as its type all the products that will be stored in the shop

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Stock.Products bread
    our bread product we have in our shop
    private Stock.Products butter
    our butter product we have in our shop
    (package private) static int counter
    as this is a singleton there should only be one created at most, this keeps a count of singletons created so this should be at most 1
    private Stock.Products milk
    our milk product we have in our shop
    (package private) int stockId
    this id will be the counter variable assigned to this and will be used to unqiuely identify the singelton
    private static Stock stockInstance
    runs only once and only one Stock object created

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private Stock()
    the consturctor that creates all of our stock in the shop

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void buy​(int[] amt)
    a simple method to demonstrate what happens when a product is bought we only have thre products so this is an array of the amounts of bread amt[0] milk amt[1] butter amt[2]
    static Stock getStock()
    if this is the first thing done with the class, this will create our stockInstance object
    void printStock()
    we print out in detail all of the items in stockroom and in shelf in our shop

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • counter

      static int counter
      as this is a singleton there should only be one created at most, this keeps a count of singletons created so this should be at most 1

      int stockId
      this id will be the counter variable assigned to this and will be used to unqiuely identify the singelton

  • Method Details

    • getStock

      public static Stock getStock()
      if this is the first thing done with the class, this will create our stockInstance object

      we print out in detail all of the items in stockroom and in shelf in our shop
